dict.string: Remember, An incorrect answer makes the dinosaurs really sad!

array.string: So far, it’s a tie. so, let’s see.

Dinosaurs - they lived for millions of years.

dict.string: The dinosaurs dominated the Earth for over 165 million years, Homo sapiens, the species to which we belong, has existed for about 200,000 years.
Who lived longer on earth - Dinosaurs or Humans?

array.string: They had really strong teeth, never lost it.
Yes, the poor old dinos were toothless.
They got new teeth when old one fell out.

dict.string: Dinosaurs had replaceable teeth; as teeth became worn or broken they fell out and new ones grew in their places.
Did Dinosaurs lose their tooth when they grew old?

array.string: No one knows for sure, whoever went to check out did not come back.
Dinosaurs didn't sleep, they were always hunting or star-gazing.
They slept standing up and were sleep walking all the time!
They liked lying down on comfy beds made up of trees.

dict.string: There are only speculations. The giant ones would have hard time getting back up again, given their weight and size. But most dinosaurs were not enormous and didn't have tiny arms so there wouldn't be a physical problem lying down, but no one knows how they slept.
Dinosaurs slept standing up or lying down?

array.string: What else do you call a dinosaur?
Dinosaur were first discovered by Sir Richard Dinosaur, hence the name.
That's the name ancient Romans gave them.
It means terrifying lizards in greek.

dict.string: The term dinosaur was coined by the English anatomist Sir Richard Owen in 1842, who derived it from green words "deinos" (means terrifying) and "sauros" (means lizard).
Why are dinosaurs called dinosaurs?

array.string: Green, so they could hide behind trees.
Brown, and they didn’t need to hide.
Brown on front, green on back.
Everybody is just guessing, nobody knows.

dict.string: The only remains of the dinosaurs are fossils. The pigmentation (the color) of dinosaurs' skin is not preserved in the fossils, so no one knows what color they were.
What colors the dinosaurs were?
Many dinosaurs such as Brachiosaurus, Protoceratops, Stegosaurus, Triceratops, Diplodocus, Apatosaurus were plant eaters.
Most dinosaurs were..

array.string: Kenya - Tanzania border where oldest dinosaur fossils were found
The time when Dinosaurs became extinct.

dict.string: Alvarez theory explains dinosaurs became exticts at the K-T boundary due to asteroid hitting earth. That impact, combined with geological changes and volcanic eruptions, most likely led to extinction of dinosaurs and about 50 percent of other species on Earth.
What is referred as K-T boundary?
Dinosaurs got their start as small, meat-eating creatures 230 million years ago.
When did dinosaurs first appear?
Reptiles are a group of animals that includes lizards , snakes , turtles , dinosaurs , and in some classifications, birds.
Dinosaurs belonged to which group of animals
Most paleontologists believe that the birds probably evolved from the maniraptors, a branch of bird-like dinosaurs.
Which modern day species are evolved from Dinosaurs?

array.string: They were fighting, and killed each other.
There was a flu outbreak and they never took flu shots.
An asteroid colliding with the Earth.
They ate poisonous stuff and there were no vets around.

dict.string: A widely accepted theory is that an asteroid 4-9 miles in diameter hit the Earth about 65 million years ago. The impact, off the Yucatan peninsula, would have penetrated the Earth's crust, scattered dust and debris into the atmosphere, and caused huge fires, volcanic activity , tsunamis, severe storms with high winds and highly acidic rain.
What probably caused the extinction of the dinosaurs?
There were a lot of flying reptiles that lived at the same time the dinosaurs did, but the Dinosaurs lived their entire lives on land.
Were there any flying dinosaurs?
Maiasauras were duck-billed dinosaurs that grew to be about 30 feet long & weighed 3-4 tons
Which of the following is a dinosaur
Spinosaurus, which also had the longest head of the meat eating dinosaurs, weighed up to 9.9 tons.
What dinosaur is the world's largest carnivore?
Compsognathus was a chicken-sized, carnivorous dinosaur from the Jurassic period.
What is the smallest dinosaur known yet?

array.string: It is a lingering question on which scientists have not agreed yet.

dict.string: Any definite conclusions about dinosaur metabolism will have to await future discoveries
